definition: variant of 合併|合并[he2 bing4]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge

sentences.english: Our club has affiliated with a national society.
sentences.chinese: 我們俱樂部已與一個全國性協會合並。

sentences.english: Enterprise network expansion as a result of mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.chinese: 企業收購和合並導致的企業網絡擴充。

sentences.english: Support for multiple accounting standards and partial ownership consolidations.
sentences.chinese: 支持多種會計標準和合並部分所有權。

sentences.english: We also discuss branches and merging.
sentences.chinese: 我們也會探討分支和合並。

sentences.english: Objective To analyze the experience of the surgical treatment of valvular heart disease with enlarged left ventricle.
sentences.chinese: 目的總結合並大左室瓣膜病的治療經驗。

sentences.english: The noticeable problems relate to the correct branching and merging of the cyclic flows.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的問題與循環流的正確分支和合並有關。

sentences.english: Iberia is trying to complete its merge with British Airways, a deal announced last November.
sentences.chinese: 在去年11月，西航宣佈要和英航完成合並。

sentences.english: "EA was not pushing us to consolidate, " Castle says.
sentences.chinese: “EA沒有推動我們完成合並，”卡斯通說。

sentences.english: He would also renationalise and merge the electricity and gas utility.
sentences.chinese: 他也可以重新國有化和合並電力和煤氣單位。

sentences.english: Overall, the benefits of amblyopia treatment occurred with a low chance of complications, according to Dr. Repka.
sentences.chinese: 總的來說合並症越多的患者治療效果越差。

definition: see 國務院國有資產監督管理委員會|国务院国有资产监督管理委员会[Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Guo2 you3 Zi1 chan3 Jian1 du1 Guan3 li3 Wei3 yuan2 hui4]
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to inject funds/to put money into (the market)
first draft/to draw up (a first version)
